documents.title: API Server
documents.summary: This document describes the Klipper API server interface, detailing how to enable the socket connection, the JSON-RPC request format, and the available endpoints for querying or controlling the printer software.

documents.title: Axis Twist Compensation
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the axis twist compensation module to correct for probe inaccuracies caused by physical rail twists in 3D printers.

documents.title: BLTouch
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for connecting, configuring, and testing a BL-Touch sensor with Klipper firmware. It includes troubleshooting steps for common hardware issues and specific configuration requirements for various sensor versions and clones.

documents.title: Bed Level
documents.summary: This document explains the importance of bed leveling in Klipper and provides a detailed guide on performing the 'paper test' to calibrate Z-height accurately.

documents.title: Beaglebone
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for installing and configuring Klipper on Beaglebone hardware, specifically focusing on utilizing the PRU cores and Linux host processes.

documents.title: Bed Mesh
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and use the Bed Mesh module to compensate for bed surface irregularities in 3D printers. It details parameters for probe point generation on different bed shapes and advanced interpolation settings to improve first-layer adhesion.

documents.title: Benchmarks
documents.summary: This document explains the methodology and procedures for benchmarking the maximum stepping rates of various micro-controllers supported by Klipper. It provides specific configuration sequences and baseline performance metrics for different hardware platforms.

documents.title: Bootloader Entry
documents.summary: This document explains the technical methods and commands required to instruct a Klipper micro-controller to reboot into its bootloader via virtual serial, physical serial, or CANBUS interfaces.

documents.title: Bootloaders
documents.summary: This document provides technical information and specific procedures for flashing bootloaders and firmware onto various micro-controllers supported by Klipper.

documents.title: CANBUS
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions for setting up and configuring CAN bus communication in Klipper, including hardware requirements, host operating system setup, and device identification.

documents.title: CANBUS Troubleshooting
documents.summary: This document outlines diagnostic procedures and technical solutions for identifying and resolving communication issues in Klipper CAN bus setups, covering physical wiring, software updates, and kernel configurations.

documents.title: CANBUS protocol
documents.summary: This document specifies the communication protocol used by Klipper for micro-controller interaction over CAN bus, detailing node identification and message framing.

documents.title: Command Templates
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement and format G-Code command sequences using Jinja2 templates for macro configuration. It covers macro naming, parameter handling, state management, and accessing real-time printer status variables.

documents.title: CONTRIBUTING
documents.summary: This document outlines the contribution process for Klipper, detailing the pull request workflow, code review criteria, and documentation requirements for new submissions.

documents.title: Code Overview
documents.summary: This document provides an architectural overview of the Klipper software, detailing its directory structure, micro-controller execution flow, and host-side threading models.

documents.title: Config Changes
documents.summary: This document provides a chronological log of non-backwards compatible configuration changes and feature deprecations in Klipper software to assist users during upgrades.

documents.title: Config Reference
documents.summary: This document serves as a detailed reference for Klipper firmware configuration, explaining parameters for micro-controllers, pin assignments, and printer motion settings.

documents.title: Config checks
documents.summary: This document outlines essential post-installation diagnostic steps to verify pin settings and hardware functionality in the Klipper printer configuration file. It provides procedures for testing temperature sensors, heaters, stepper motors, endstops, and performing PID calibration.

documents.title: Delta Calibrate
documents.summary: This document describes the process for performing basic and enhanced delta calibration on Klipper-based 3D printers to ensure accurate motion and dimensional precision.

documents.title: Debugging
documents.summary: This document outlines various debugging tools and methods for Klipper, providing instructions for regression testing, motion analysis, log extraction, and hardware simulation. It teaches users how to use specialized scripts to troubleshoot micro-controller commands and analyze printer performance data.

documents.title: Contact
documents.summary: This document directs users to the appropriate communication channels for Klipper support, feature requests, and provides specific instructions for reporting software bugs.

documents.title: Endstop Phase
documents.summary: This document explains how to use Klipper's stepper phase adjusted endstop system to improve homing accuracy by synchronizing endstop triggers with specific stepper motor phases.

documents.title: Eddy Probe
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for configuring and calibrating an eddy current inductive probe in Klipper, covering drive current, Z-height correlation, and tap-based probing.

documents.title: Example Configs
documents.summary: This document outlines the specific requirements and guidelines for contributing 3D printer configuration files to the Klipper firmware repository.

documents.title: Exclude Object
documents.summary: This document explains the functionality and workflow of the Klipper exclude_object module, which allows users to cancel specific components of a multi-part 3D print in progress.

documents.title: FAQ
documents.summary: A collection of frequently asked questions for the Klipper 3D printer firmware, addressing common issues related to installation, hardware requirements, and controller board configuration.

documents.title: Features
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of the technical features and capabilities of the Klipper 3D printer firmware, focusing on its precision, performance, and hardware versatility.

documents.title: G Codes
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive reference of the standard and extended G-Code commands supported by the Klipper firmware for 3D printer control.

documents.title: Hall Filament Width Sensor
documents.summary: This document describes the implementation, operation, and calibration of a Hall-effect filament width sensor module used to adjust extrusion multipliers in real-time.

documents.title: Installation
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions for installing Klipper firmware, covering host software setup, firmware compilation, and microcontroller flashing. It also guides users on selecting configuration files and choosing a front-end interface for printer control.

documents.title: Kinematics
documents.summary: This document explains the internal mechanics of Klipper's motion system, covering constant acceleration, look-ahead algorithms, and the conversion of Cartesian coordinates into stepper motor steps.

documents.title: Load Cell
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up, calibrate, and use load cells within Klipper for force measurement and nozzle contact probing, including diagnostic procedures and safety configurations.

documents.title: MCU Commands
documents.summary: This document details the low-level micro-controller commands used by Klipper's host software to configure and control hardware peripherals. It provides technical specifications for startup routines, configuration phases, and the management of internal objects like GPIO pins and steppers.

documents.title: Manual Level
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for calibrating the Z endstop and manually leveling a 3D printer bed using Klipper's software tools and probe-assisted calculations.

documents.title: Measuring Resonances
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions for connecting and configuring accelerometers to measure printer resonances and calibrate input shapers in Klipper. It covers hardware compatibility, wiring diagrams for various MCUs, physical mounting requirements, and software dependency installation.

documents.title: Multi MCU Homing
documents.summary: This document explains Klipper's multi-mcu homing feature, detailing how sensors and motors can operate across different micro-controllers and the resulting technical considerations like overshoot and latency.

documents.title: OctoPrint
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for installing and configuring OctoPrint as a frontend interface for the Klipper 3D printer firmware using OctoPi or KIAUH.

documents.title: Packaging
documents.summary: This document provides technical instructions for packaging Klipper, detailing requirements for C module compilation, Python pre-compilation, and versioning without git.

documents.title: Overview
documents.summary: This document serves as the central index and navigation hub for the Klipper 3D printer firmware documentation, organizing resources into installation, configuration, and developer-focused sections.

documents.title: Pressure Advance
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for tuning the pressure advance setting to minimize oozing and corner blobbing in 3D prints. It explains how to print a calibration tower, calculate the ideal value, and apply the results to the printer configuration.

documents.title: Protocol
documents.summary: This document explains the Klipper messaging protocol, a low-level RPC mechanism for communication between host software and micro-controllers, detailing its command declaration system and binary encoding format.

documents.title: Probe Calibrate
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for calibrating the X, Y, and Z offsets of automatic Z probes in Klipper firmware to ensure accurate bed leveling. It also explains how to verify probe repeatability and identify potential location-based measurement biases.

documents.title: README
documents.summary: This document serves as the introductory landing page for the Klipper 3D printer firmware documentation, providing a starting point for users.

documents.title: RPi microcontroller
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure a Raspberry Pi as a secondary micro-controller for Klipper, enabling direct control of the host's GPIO pins, SPI, and I2C buses.

documents.title: Releases
documents.summary: This document provides a chronological history of Klipper releases, detailing major feature updates, expanded hardware support, and architectural improvements for each version. It serves as a comprehensive changelog for tracking the development and evolution of the Klipper 3D printer firmware.

documents.title: Resonance Compensation
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and tune Klipper's input shaping feature to mitigate ringing and mechanical vibrations in 3D prints. It provides step-by-step instructions for measuring resonance frequencies and selecting appropriate compensation parameters.

documents.title: Rotation Distance
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for calculating and calibrating the rotation_distance parameter for stepper motors in Klipper, covering various hardware setups like belts, lead screws, and extruders.

documents.title: SDCard Updates
documents.summary: This document explains how to update Klipper firmware on controller boards using the SD card flashing script, providing a remote alternative to manual physical updates. It covers installation steps, command-line arguments, troubleshooting for specific hardware, and instructions for adding new board definitions.

documents.title: Skew Correction
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for calibrating and configuring software-based skew correction to resolve dimensional inaccuracies in 3D printer builds.

documents.title: Slicers
documents.summary: This document provides recommendations and configuration tips for optimizing 3D printing slicers, such as Cura and Slic3r, for use with Klipper firmware.

documents.title: Sponsors
documents.summary: This document acknowledges the official sponsors, key developers, and related open-source projects that support the Klipper 3D printer firmware ecosystem. It provides information on how to support the project through donations and lists compatible software projects.

documents.title: Status Reference
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive reference of the printer status information and object fields available for use in Klipper macros, display configurations, and the API server.

documents.title: TMC Drivers
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for configuring and optimizing Trinamic stepper motor drivers in Klipper, including guidance on current tuning, communication modes, and sensorless homing.

documents.title: TSL1401CL Filament Width Sensor
documents.summary: This document explains the functionality and configuration of the TSL1401CL-based filament width sensor for automatic extrusion multiplier adjustment.

documents.title: Using PWM Tools
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on setting up and controlling PWM-based tools such as lasers and spindles using pwm_tool macros and G-code commands.

documents.title: Index
documents.summary: This document provides an introduction to the Klipper 3D printer firmware, explaining its basic architecture and providing links to installation and feature documentation.
